::: {.column-margin}
### Publication Glance
In the field of computer science, top-tier conferences, in addition to journals, are venues for publishing highly selective, double-blind, peer-reviewed, archival publications. Top-tier venues in human-computer interaction research appear at ACM conferences such as CHI and CSCW. They are highly selective and often exceed journals in their selectivity, visibility, and impact. Submissions undergo multiple rounds of review before being accepted for publication.
:::
